sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Our patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. We prioritize listening to and caring for our patients to build long-term relationships with them and help them reach their dental goals. Learn more here.

posts.title: Golden Moment
posts.content:
Yes, more baseball. Kevin Kopps won the 43rd Golden Spikes Award last night, making him the second Razorback ever to have won the award.

  • They really golden? Might as well be. The Golden Spikes is considered the most prestigious award in college baseball and is based on athleticism, sportsmanship, character, and overall awesomeness.
  • Trophy cabinet: Kopps also won the Dick Howser Trophy, was named the SEC Pitcher of the Year, Pitcher of the Year, as well as National Player of the Year. You can watch the moment he won here.

Who was the other Arkansas player that won both the Dick Howser Trophy and Golden Spikes? (answer at the bottom)

posts.title: The Reel Deal
posts.content:
We're doing it live. The Bentonville Film Foundation (BFF) announced the line-up of films debuting in the 2021 film competitions.

  • Preview: Scheduled for Aug. 2-8 this year's event will combine virtual and in-person activities, including premieres, conversations, awards, and events.
  • Special edition: Attendees will enjoy a 30th anniversary screening of Thelma & Louise at the 112 Drive-In in Fayetteville followed by conversations with Academy Award winners Geena David and Callie Khouri.

Find the full line up, tickets, and everything else about BFF HERE.

posts.title: Cheap Date
posts.content:
Grandma always told you to stretch your dollar. According to Assemble, NWA ranks as 9th in the nation amongst cities where your dollar goes the furthest, so you're making grandma proud by living here.

  • High earners: While NWA landed in the middle of the top 15 taking into account income and cost of living, the region topped this list in per capita income - 20% higher than the next highest on the list!
  • Did you know? Our home region "boasts seven times the national average of headquarters and management employees".

If you want to learn more about this list, you can find it HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
On the job hunt? Check out these new jobs posted to our community board this week:

  • NWA Daily, yes that is us, we're looking for a Managing Editor to run our newsletter.
  • Supply Pike is looking for a Senior Replenishment Analyst.
  • EforAll is seeking a Project Manager for the Northwest Arkansas chapter.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here for FREE, and we might feature it next week!

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
What we've all been waiting for - here is what we recommend checking out this weekend in NWA:

  • Summer Sidewalk Sale: Saturday downtown Springdale will be hosting a summer sidewalk sale with plenty of local vendors.
  • Cycling Festival: Downtown Rogers is hosting its annual, family-friendly cycling festival this Saturday, which includes the Bike Film Festival Tour.
  • Music events: With 30+ live music performance happening this weekend, it will be tough to not hear some good tunes.
  • Game night: Arkansas Naturals take on in-state rivals, Arkansas Travelers this weekend at Arvest ball park.
  • Pro tour: Buckin' in the Ozarks PBR Tour is making a stop this weekend in Springdale.
  • Sun bathing: In both Fayetteville and Bentonville there is free yoga sessions happening on Sunday.
  • Sunny's on Second: Sunny's, a food and juice bar in downtown Bentonville is opening on Sunday.
  • Food Truck Rodeo: Food trucks and live music happening this Sunday at Crystal Bridges.

See you Monday!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Hops drop: New Province Brewing is dropping a new Double IPA today at 1p.
  • Help me help you: United Way is awarding funds to several organizations in the area.
  • Great success: NWA Council's Life Works Here campaign received 30k+ applications from all 50 states and 115 countries.
  • I scream for ice cream: National Ice Cream Day is Sunday, and you can celebrate at Braum's with 75Â¢ single dip cones.
  • Olympic training: Team Canada spent the last month training in Bentonville for the Olympics.
  • Work with us: NWA Daily wants to feature your business! Check out the advertising options on our website.
  • Quiz answer: Andrew Benintendi was the other Razorback that won the Dick Howser and Golden Spikes awards
